segments.label: Pre-synaptic Neuron
segments.description: The glowing orange neuron on the left, with its intricate dendrites, initiating the neural communication by preparing to send a signal.

segments.label: Synaptic Communication
segments.description: The crucial interface where neurotransmitters, depicted as orange spheres, are released across the synaptic cleft to transmit the signal between neurons.

segments.label: Post-synaptic Neuron
segments.description: The vibrant blue neuron on the right, with its extensive dendritic tree, receiving the incoming neural signal to process and propagate it further.

segments.label: Neural Signal Impulse
segments.description: The energetic blue wave representing the electrical action potential, propagating rapidly along the axon of the receiving neuron after signal transmission.
